title: AngioSeal Versus Radial Approach in Acute Coronary Syndrome

metadata.brief_title: AngioSeal Versus Radial Approach in Acute Coronary Syndrome
metadata.brief_summary: Among non-ST-segment elevation acute coronary syndrome patients submitted to early invasive strategy and randomized for the transfemoral or transradial approach, the AngioSeal vascular closure device would decrease the prevalence of vascular complications at puncture site, reaching the non-inferiority criterion when compared to the radial access.
